messages: 76680563b02870d015080e95984df8fc (21:17): Personally, I would like to see way of making form fields disable after choosing certain radio buttons or checkboxes... but yeah... Web Forms is already big part of HTML5 specification...
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:38): Do Firefox nightlies auto-update on Windows?
1bc60e792d59a36f79d0feed2b681ce2 (21:39): daily
76680563b02870d015080e95984df8fc (21:39): http://kb.mozillazine.org/Software_update
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:39): 76680563b02870d015080e95984df8fc, I was mostly directly the question to the various Mozilla devs who hang out here.
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:39): you'll get an annoying dialog every morning
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:40): and if it's your irc client, you'll have to disconnect daily
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:40): on mondays, you'll get 2 updates
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:40): on to update from friday to saturday (small)
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:40): s/on to/one to/
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:40): and one to update from saturday to monday (full)
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:40): if you're really unlucky, you could get 3 updates
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:41): one to update friday to saturday, one to update saturday to sunday, and an hour later, one to update from sunday to monday :)
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:41): oh, and for extra restarts (and a chance for a bonus reboot), you can install Adobe Flash and Adobe Reader
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (21:41): Unless you work during the weekend
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:41): (reader wants me to reboot)
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:41): oh, to do that, you need a "home pc", and this "internet to the home" thing
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:41): is kinda missing those
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:42): e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af, this is why I don't use Firefox as my IRC client.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:43): I originally used Chatzilla but abandoned the idea very rapidly.
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:43): chatzilla can be hosted by xulrunner (discontinued)
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:43): but, those irc clients only work if your irc server
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:43): 's irc port is reachable from your computer
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:43): if not, you need something else (i use http)
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:44): hrm, IE has two modes in Metro...
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:45): By "two", do you mean eight?
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:45): Windowed and Metro
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:46): i'd been using Windowed initially and didn't realize it was also a Metro app
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:46): Are they orthogonal to the compatibility modes?
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:46): i tried loading http://google.com from explorer, and suddenly i got launched into Metro
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:46): i'd assume so
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:46): this is just a UI thing
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:47): Time to generate tests in Chrome on my desktop: 27:48.740min.
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:47): http://www.favbrowser.com/internet-explorer-10-screenshots-and-video/
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:47): Time on my cloud VM: 2:56.945 min.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:47): Sounds like a win.
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:48): Why so much difference?
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:48): Presumably because my CPU is a piece of garbage.
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:48): Is your desktop running on a Pentium 2 or something?
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:49): No, an Athlon X2 64 5000+ or something.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:50): I don't know what the VM is using, but it's evidently better.
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:51): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: can i have a thank=you? :)
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:51): e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af, thank you!
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:51): And to ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c et al.
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:51): Is it supposedly 3.25 x "a 1.0-1.2 GHz 2007 Opteron or 2007 Xeon processor"?
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:51): the cloud probably also has a much better hard disk, and probably network pipe :)
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:52): thanks ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c and zewt for providing the actual guidance to get 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 past the idea phase
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:52): Interesting, the Firefox nightly still takes 12:55min.
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:53): :(
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:53): wonders if the main problem with the X2 is that it has tiny L2 cache, because he doesn't know why else there'd be an order of magnitude difference
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:53): ActivePython-2.7.2.5-win64-x64.msi is not commonly downloaded and could harm yo
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:54): i supposed that IE10 is trying to be in with the 90s
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:54): `could harm yo`
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:57): Are nightlies less optimized than Aurora, by any chance?
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (21:59): what's the problem?
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:59): Nothing, I was just surprised that Chrome seemed to show a ridiculously bigger speedup from my desktop to VM than Firefox did.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:59): I switched from Aurora on my desktop to Nightly on the VM, so I wondered if that might be related.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (22:00): (I didn't wind up using Chrome Canary because it sad-tabbed)
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (22:01): no idea, but if you try Aurora on your VM and Nightly is a lot slower than it, I'd appreciate a  bug report
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (22:05): will fiddle
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (22:05): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: fwiw, windows has some nice profiling stuff
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (22:05): if you're willing to do some extra work to see what's up
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (22:05): I'm not really.
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (22:05): yeah, i didn't expect you were
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (22:05): At least not right now.
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (22:05): if your vm doesn't have anything confidential in it, you might want to let someone clone it
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (22:06): isn't sure how clonable Amazon items are
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (22:06): My VM has nothing useful in it whatsoever, it's a fresh Windows install with some browsers added.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (22:06): Anyone can trivially replicate it.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (22:11): There's no way to append text piece by piece to a textarea's value that's not O(n^2), is there?
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (22:11): Or should I just append it to the DOM as a child of the textarea?
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (22:11): tries that
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (22:22): Hmm, now Chrome is back to taking a long time too.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (22:22): Maybe the earlier result was a fluke or bug or something.
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:24): You should file a bug report: "Sometimes Chrome is too fast"
76680563b02870d015080e95984df8fc (22:29): On hardware made 7 years ago, Chrome is kinda slow...
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (22:33): CPUs haven't gotten a lot faster in seven years.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (22:33): Certainly not ten times faster.
cc7bcfbc58c467939c5987584fc882cb (22:34): hardware acceleration perhaps?
cc7bcfbc58c467939c5987584fc882cb (22:35): i was serious
cc7bcfbc58c467939c5987584fc882cb (22:36): some drawing operations may be hardware accelerated on system A, but won't be hardware accelerated on system B
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (22:36): 1) Hardware acceleration seems unlikely on a Windows Server VM.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (22:36): 2) Basically nothing is being painted here, if the browsers are being sane at all.
cc7bcfbc58c467939c5987584fc882cb (22:37): sw rendering can be pretty fast if there is no ram->bus->vram copy stuff going on (also true in a headless environment)
cc7bcfbc58c467939c5987584fc882cb (22:38): well, i have no clue what your tests are doing :)
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (22:42): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: maybe your tests ended early because of a bug?
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (22:42): 042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427, yeah, that's what I suspect at this point.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (22:43): It seemed like a ridiculous speedup.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (22:43): The speedup I saw in Firefox was more like 2x, which is reasonable.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (22:43): I think I'll want to upgrade to the four-core version so I can run two sets of tests in parallel.

042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (22:44): about appending to a textarea ... of course the best way is to build up a JS string and append it to the textarea in one go, but presumably you can't do that for some reason
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (22:45): I actually can.  I don't think the constant factors are hurting me much here, though, given how much work I'm doing per test.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (22:45): Currently I'm using appendData() on the text node child, so it should be linear.
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (22:46): I wouldn't bet on that
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (22:46): Because the underlying storage might have to get reallocated regularly or something?
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (22:46): Is there any easy way for me to get good profiling data on Firefox or Chrome?
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (22:47): Hmm, Firebug works now, maybe that will help.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (22:47): Of course, it makes things take forever.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (22:49): I might have introduced an infinite loop somewhere here or something.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (22:55): Apparently building the string in pure JS made a ridiculous performance difference.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (22:55): Like over an order of magnitude compared to building it in the DOM.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (22:56): I have to double-check how much time my test framework is using here compared to the actual tests themselves.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (22:57): Firefox and Chrome now both take ~1min on the VM.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (22:58): has to check that the results are good, of course
353fa4cc248867e98de9cab7d122c320 (23:01): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: in chrome try the timeline panel in the inspector
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:01): How will the timeline help, without actual profiling?
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:02): Changing to not append stuff to the DOM makes it take like 4 minutes in Chrome and 2 minutes in Firefox on my desktop instead of like 20 minutes . . .
353fa4cc248867e98de9cab7d122c320 (23:02): ah, well there's also a profiler
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:02): might not need this VM thingie after all
353fa4cc248867e98de9cab7d122c320 (23:02): yeah always always batch
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:05): I didn't think it would be an issue given how much work I was doing per test . . .
